raw_text:
Singer Ferguson 'facing eviction'
 
 Three Degrees star Sheila Ferguson is the favourite to be evicted from ITV's I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here on Monday.
 
 Bookmakers Ladbrokes says the singer has even odds of being the first contestant to be voted off the show. "It's going to be close but Sheila is favourite as she has shown herself to be a bit of a troublemaker," said Ladbrokes' Warren Lush. Comic Joe Pasquale remains odds on favourite to win the reality show. Mr Lush added that Nancy Sorrell's chances of an early departure had increased since the surprise arrival of husband Vic Reeves in the jungle camp last Wednesday. Notwithstanding, comedian Reeves remains 3/1 favourite to win the show, after Pasquale.
 
 Huggy Bear actor Antonio Fargas also remains a contender for eviction having "done nothing to live up to the pre-show hype". "There has been a big gamble on Natalie [Appleton] to go... but bookies fancy the millions at home will keep piling on the misery by putting her through more bushtucker trials," added Mr Lush. The former All Saint star has performed dismally in bushtucker trials which have seen her plunged into glass tanks containing putrid waste and challenged to eat fish eyes. On Friday, Ladbrokes suspended betting after singer Brian Harvey quit the show folllowing a blazing row with Janet Street-Porter. Harvey, who entered the camp a day later than other contestants after learning that his grandmother had died, reached the end of his tether following days of meagre rations and rows.

Bookmakers Ladbrokes say Sheila has 3/1 odds of being voted off, while comedian Joe Pasquale remains favourite to win.
Comic Vic Reeves also remains a contender for eviction, despite increasing chances since his appearance in the jungle camp last Wednesday.

Huggy Bear actor Brian Harvey has quit following a row with Janet Street-Porter over a meager rations and rows during a bushtucker trial.

The bookmakers Ladbrokes say that the singer has even odds of being the first contestant to be voted off the show.

"It's going to be close but Sheila is favourite as she has shown herself to be a bit of a troublemaker," said Ladbrokes' Warren Lush, added that comedy Joe Pasquale remains odds on favourite to win the reality show.
Mr Lush also praised Nancy Sorrell's chances of an early departure had increased since the surprise arrival of husband Vic Reeves in the jungle camp last Wednesday.
Despite comedian Reeves remaining a favourite, he has shown some signs of dishing up.

Huggy Bear actor Antonio Fargas, who hasn't made any significant contributions to living life to share with others, also remains a contender for eviction having "done nothing to live up to the pre-show hype".
On Friday, Ladbrokes suspended betting after singer Brian Harvey quit the show following a blazing row with Janet Street-Porter.

tinyllama:1.1b: Singer Sheila Ferguson is the current favorite to be evicted from "ITV's I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here" according to bookmaker Ladbrokes, with odds as low as 3/1.
However, comedian Joe Pasqualenke has remained a contender for the title since arriving in the jungle camp last week, while Nancy Sorrell remains an early favorite to win the show.
Actress Antonio Fargas is also still in the running for eviction despite doing "nothing to live up to the pre-show hype."
Ladbrokes has placed bets on Natalie Appleton making it through more bushtucker trial seasons, but she faces a "gamble" of being put through further grueling trials.
With singer Brian Harvey's exit and recent arguments with Jane Street-Porter, the bookmaker has suspended betting following the exit of Harvey.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The star of I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here, Sheila Ferguson, is reportedly facing eviction from the show.
As fans anxiously await her fate, bookies have given odds to several contestants, but Sheilla appears to be favored to go.
However, this may change as the season unfolds.
Ladbrokes, the bookmaking company that provides odds for the reality show, has recently altered their betting on some of the contestants.
They have taken away some of their earlier odds to include Antonio Fargas and Nancy Sorrell in their predictions.
However, the numbers remain high for these two comedians to make it into the top three.
Sheila Ferguson is favored to be evicted by Ladbrokes, but they also have a surprising number of favorites.
Including Huggy Bear actor Antonio Fargas, who has not performed well in his tasks and seemed to be underwhelmed by the show's format.
Normally, these bookies odds would indicate that it's a foregone conclusion that one or two contestants will go home before the final episode, but this time there is a lot of uncertainty.
It could also change throughout the season as other contestants and even the show itself surprise everyone with their behavior.
